text: MILANO Italian filter maker GVS received enough orders from investors to cover its 490-580 million euros initial public offering (IPO) across the entire price range just a few hours after opening the order books, two market sources said on Friday.Earlier this week the group said it was pricing its IPO at between 7.0-8.3 euros per share, valuing the filter maker at up to 1.45 billion euros ($1.6 billion) after COVID-19 boosted demand for protective masks and filters for medical ventilators.
